member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.DeliveryReport
member.summary: A DeliveryReport object holds all the settings and values of a Delivery Report.

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.DeliveryReport.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.DeliveryReport.State
member.summary: This property indicates the final state of the message as given by the Network operator. Typical values are: RETRIEVED: Message was successfully delivered to destination. REJECTED: Message was rejected by the receiver. ... some others

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.DeliveryReport.ReceiverNumber
member.summary: The number of the receiver that the message was originally sent to.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.DeliveryReport.SenderNumber
member.summary: The sender number.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.DeliveryReport.Reference
member.summary: A unique reference value that corresponds to the Reference value from the Message object from the particular Message that this Delivery Report is related to.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.DeliveryReport.DeliveredDate
member.summary: The Date and Time when the message was delivered to the handset (in local MMSC time)

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient
member.summary: MMS Client implementation for PSWinCom MMS Gateway

member.name: F:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.Messages
member.summary: Collection of outgoing Message objects. Add your Message objects to this collection before sending the messages.

member.name: F:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.ReceivedMessages
member.summary: Collection of incoming Message objects. This collection will contain the received messages after running HandleIncomingMessages. The collection is emptied by the HandleIncomingMessages() method.

member.name: F:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.DeliveryReports
member.summary: Collection of received DeliveryReport objects. This collection will contain the received delivery reports after running HandleIncomingMessages. The collection is emptied by the HandleIncomingMessages() method.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.Username
member.summary: Username on MMS Gateway

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.Password
member.summary: Password on MMS Gateway

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.PrimaryGateway
member.summary: PSWinCom MMS Gateway Primary address

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.SecondaryGateway
member.summary: PSWinCom MMS Gateway Secondary address

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.SessionData
member.summary: SessionData. Leave empty if not required.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.AffiliateProgram
member.summary: Affiliate program identificator. Leave empty if not required.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.Proxy
member.summary: Set IWebProxy to be used when sending messages. Only required if you access internet through a Proxy.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.BulkWithIdenticalContent
member.summary: If this property is set, the MMSClient will send the content to the MMS Gateway only once per session. That will result in substantial lower transmission time for large sessions. When sending bulk MMS with identical content you should therefore set this property to true. Default value is false.

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.SendMessages
member.summary: Send all messages in the Messages collection. This operation will block while communicating with the Gateway. After it has been completed, the MMSMessage objects in the Messages collection is updated with the Status, (and if applicable, also the Reference or FailedReason properties)

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.HandleIncomingMessages(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads Xml from given stream and retrieves incoming messages or delivery reports within the XML document. The Messages or DeliveryReport are stored in the IncomingMessages or DeliveryReports collection.

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.GetDocumentXml
member.summary: Build XmlDocument with messages to send.
member.returns: XmlDocument according to DTD for SMS Gateway

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.GetMessageXml(System.Xml.XmlDocument,PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Build Xml for a particular message

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.CreateElement(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a XmlElement with given name and value

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.CheckResponse(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary: Check response from Gateway, update Message collection with status

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.CheckRequest(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary: Check request for IncomingMessages/DeliveryReports from Gateway, update Message collection or DeliveryReport collection

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.GetNodeValue(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.String)
member.summary: Return value of given node as by xpath expression, or null if not found
member.returns: Content of node as string or null if not found

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.GetParts(System.String)
member.summary: Decode base 64 data, unzip binary stream and retrieve each part
member.param: Base 64 encoded data containing MMS message in ZIP file format

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSClient.HttpPost(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.String)
member.summary: Send a HTTP Post request

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSException
member.summary: SMSException class for SMS Client related exceptions.

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MessageStatus
member.summary: Enumeration of the various status values a message may have. Only applies to outgoing messages

member.name: F:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MessageStatus.New
member.summary: Indicates a newly added message that has not yet been sent.

member.name: F:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MessageStatus.Sent
member.summary: Indicates a message that has been successfully sent

member.name: F:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MessageStatus.Failed
member.summary: Indicates a message that has been tried sent, but failed

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage
member.summary: An MMSMessage object holds all the settings and values of an MMS message. This class is used both for incoming outgoing messages, but not all properties are valid for incoming messages.

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.RequestReceipt
member.summary: Set to true to request a receipt (Delivery Report) for this message. The delivery report will either be available on the account web or forwarded to your application depending on your account settings on the MMS Gateway.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.Subject
member.summary: The subject of the MMS message to send

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.ReceiverNumber
member.summary: The number of the receiver. The number must be an internationally formatted number. That is a number that includes country prefix. Any spaces or leading "00" and "+" will be removed and should thus be avoided.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.SenderNumber
member.summary: The sender number of the MMS. This will normally be overriden by MMS Gateway to reflect the CPA shortnumer in use.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.Status
member.summary: Indicates the status of the message. The MessageStatus enumeration holds the various states that may occur. This property is read-only and is updated only as a result of a SendMessages() operation.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.Reference
member.summary: If RequestReceipt is set to true and your Gateway account has been enabled for delivery report forwarding, then the Reference property will hold a unique Reference value for this particular message after successfully issuing a SendMessages() operation. This Reference value can later be used to correlate the Message with a Delivery Report received at a later time. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.Network
member.summary: Can be set to indicate a specific routing of this message. Should only be used for sending of Premium MMS messages where specific routing is required. Other usage of this may result in the message not being delivered.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.Tariff
member.summary: Indicated the Premium Price in cents/ører for a message sent as a Premium MMS. This requires that the account has been enabled for CPA/Premium MMS usage.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.FailedReason
member.summary: If a message was not accepted by the MMS Gateway you may find a more specific reason for this by checking this property. It will be empty for successfully submitted messages. This property is read-only and is updated only as a result of a SendMessages() operation.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.Address
member.summary: For incoming messages the Gateway may include information about the name and address of the person that is registered to the SenderNumber. This is a value-added feature that will require a separate agreement with PSWinCom.

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.GetCompressed
member.summary: Pack up the content of this MMSMessage as a zip file for suitable transmission to the MMS Gateway

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.SaveParts(System.String)
member.summary: Save all content parts to the given path using original filenames for each part
member.param: A valid path to a directory

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.SaveCompressed(System.String)
member.summary: Save all MMS message parts as one compressed file. Suitable for packing content for storing and later sending.

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.SaveCompressed(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Save all MMS message parts as a zip to a stream. Suitable for packing content for storing in database or such,

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessage.LoadCompressed(System.String)
member.summary: Loads compressed MMS message parts from file. Existing content in MMSMessage object will be overwritten.

member.name: T:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessagePart
member.summary: An MMSMessagePart object holds the name and content data for each part of the MMS message. It will typically be a picture, sound, text or similar.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessagePart.Name
member.summary: Name of this content part. Typically this is the filename of the content file.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessagePart.PartId
member.summary: Numeric id number of this particular part.

member.name: P:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessagePart.Data
member.summary: A byte array holding the data of this content part.

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessagePart.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessagePart.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Construct new MMSMessagePart from file

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessagePart.Load(System.String)
member.summary: Load content from file into this MMS part
member.param: Complete path and filename of content file to load

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessagePart.GetAsString
member.summary: Get the content as a string using default (ISO 8859 1) encoding. Should only be called on parts that are considered to be text-parts (Name ending with .txt or similar)

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessagePart.GetAsString(System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Get the content as a string using a specific encoding. Should only be called on parts that are considered to be text-parts (Name ending with .txt or similar)

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessagePart.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Save the content of this part to a file in the given folder using the original filename
member.param: A valid path to a directory

member.name: M:PSWinCom.Gateway.MMS.Client.MMSMessagePart.SaveAs(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Save the content of this part to a file in the given folder using the specified filename
member.param: A valid path to a directory
